turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Hi Chris, I'm thinking some pizza for lunch for our team - how does that sound to you?

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Good idea - do you have any place in mind?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Green Mill has good pizza - what'da think?

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Hmmm, I like Green Mill pizza! How many should we order?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: I think two are plenty for the team.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Oh, you forget how big and hungry of a team you have!

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Gee, your right, let's order 3 pizzas.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: What kind do you want to order?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: One pepperoni, one sausage, and one with everything!

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Oh, that would work except did you forget we have a couple of vegetarians on the team?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Let 'em eat cake! Ha- just kidding you've got a good point.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: So 1 veggie and which of the other 3 do you want to drop?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Screw the everything, I can't stand peppers anyway.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: OK. 1 Veggie, 1 Pepperoni and 1 Sausage

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Roger that. Gee, I forgot we need to pick the kind of crust, too. Why don't you go for that!

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: I like thin crust, so that's what I'm going with.

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Sounds good to me.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: OK, let me play that back for you - oh ^%$%, we didn't pick any size!

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Well, what does the web site say about sizes and number of people?

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: I'll look.....oh crap my PC froze!

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: $#%^ PC's!! Mine's working, I'll take a look at their website.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Cool - thanks

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: OK, three XL pizzas will do the trick for 15 people

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Got It. Let me read the order back to you: 1 veggie pizza, 1 sausage and 1 pepperoni. All XL and with thin crust.

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: That's a winner, chicken dinner.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: So do you want to pick it up, or delivered?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Man, ain't no way I've got time to pick it up, do you? It'd be nice to avoid tipping the delivery guy.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Sure - I'm hourly and driving is fine by me. I'll pick it up.

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Excellent - thanks!

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: I'd say 'no problem', but that phrase bugs you so, I'm off to get the pizza. It'll be ready in 25 minutes, see you in a bit.
